text:
The flag of Eswatini was adopted on October 6, 1968.
Appearance.
It has a horizontal bands of blue (top and bottom) and the yellow-edged red (triple width) with the large black and white Nguni shield covering two spears and the staff decorated with the feather tassels called "injobo" (tassels-bunches of feathers of the widowbird and the lourie) all centered horizontally of the red band.
